messages.content: Make a list of litigation against manufacturers of fluoroquinolone with dates, starting from most recent.

Here is a list of major litigation against fluoroquinolone manufacturers, in reverse chronological order:

•2018 - A Missouri jury awarded $1.5 million to a woman who claimed that Cipro caused her to develop aortic dissection and other health issues. The case was against Bayer, the maker of Cipro. 

•2016 - A Philadelphia jury awarded $1.8 million to a man who claimed that Levaquin caused him to develop aortic aneurysm and other issues. The case was against Johnson & Johnson's Janssen Pharmaceuticals unit, the maker of Levaquin.

•2015 - Bayer paid $56.9 million to settle 845 lawsuits related to claims that Cipro caused peripheral neuropathy.

•2013 - Johnson & Johnson's Janssen Pharmaceuticals paid $800,000 to settle a lawsuit with a Virginia man who claimed that Levaquin caused his tendons to rupture. 

•2010 - Johnson & Johnson's Ortho-McNeil paid $1.5 million to settle a lawsuit with a Florida man who claimed that Levaquin caused his tendons to rupture.

•2008 - Johnson & Johnson's Janssen Pharmaceuticals paid $4.45 million to settle a lawsuit with a Minnesota man who claimed that Levaquin caused his tendons to rupture.

•2006 - Ortho-McNeil, a subsidiary of Johnson & Johnson, placed a "black box" warning on Levaquin labeling to warn of the risk of tendon rupture and tendinitis. The warning came in response to many individuals filing lawsuits against the company.

•1996 - Johnson & Johnson's Ortho-McNeil first received reports of tendon ruptures associated with Levaquin use. Lawsuits against the company for failing to adequately warn about this risk started in the early 2000s.

Make a list of litigation against manufacturers of fluoroquinolone with dates, the name of the law firm that represented the plaintiffs, a summary outcome, any approximate number of affected complaintants and summary awards, starting from most recent.

Here is a list of major fluoroquinolone litigation with law firms, outcomes, and award amounts:

•2018 - A Missouri jury awarded $1.5 million to a woman represented by TorHoerman Law LLC. The case was against Bayer, the maker of Cipro. Approx. 1 plaintiff.

•2016 - A Philadelphia jury awarded $1.8 million to a man represented by Sheller P.C. The case was against Janssen Pharmaceuticals, the maker of Levaquin. Approx. 1 plaintiff. 

•2015 - Bayer paid $56.9 million to settle 845 lawsuits related to claims that Cipro caused peripheral neuropathy, represented by various law firms including Parker Waichman LLP. Approx. 845 plaintiffs. Total award $56.9 million.

•2013 - Janssen Pharmaceuticals paid $800,000 to settle a lawsuit with a Virginia man represented by Martin Law Firm. The case claimed that Levaquin caused tendon ruptures. Approx. 1 plaintiff. Total award $800,000.

•2010 - Ortho-McNeil (J&J subsidiary) paid $1.5 million to settle a lawsuit with a Florida man represented by Cartwright Law Firm. The case claimed that Levaquin caused tendon ruptures. Approx. 1 plaintiff. Total award $1.5 million.  

•2008 - Janssen Pharmaceuticals paid $4.45 million to settle a lawsuit with a Minnesota man represented by Matthews & Associates. The case claimed that Levaquin caused tendon ruptures. Approx. 1 plaintiff. Total award $4.45 million.

•2006 - Ortho-McNeil (J&J subsidiary) added warning to Levaquin label in response to litigation from various law firms including Shook, Hardy & Bacon LLP. Number of plaintiffs unknown. No major settlements.

•1996-2000s - Various lawsuits filed against Ortho-McNeil (J&J subsidiary) claiming failure to warn about Levaquin tendon rupture risk, represented by law firms including Sheller P.C. and Matthews & Associates. Outcomes and total number of plaintiffs unknown.
